name: Acropolis
description: Ancient citadel with Parthenon and other classical monuments

name: Parthenon
description: Iconic Doric temple dedicated to Athena, atop the Acropolis

name: Acropolis Museum
description: Modern museum housing finds from the Acropolis excavations

name: Ancient Agora
description: Marketplace and civic center of ancient Athens

name: Roman Agora
description: Hellenistic marketplace built under Roman rule

name: Temple of Olympian Zeus
description: Ruined colossal temple of the king of gods

name: Areopagus (Mars Hill)
description: Rocky outcrop offering panoramic views of the city

name: Mount Lycabettus
description: Highest hill in Athens with funicular and 360° vistas

name: Pnyx Hill
description: Meeting place of the ancient Athenian democratic assembly

name: Panathenaic Stadium
description: Marble stadium restored for the first modern Olympics in 1896

name: National Archaeological Museum
description: Greece’s largest museum of ancient artifacts

name: Benaki Museum
description: Eclectic collections from prehistoric to modern Greek art

name: Museum of Cycladic Art
description: Specializes in ancient Cycladic and Greek art

name: Byzantine and Christian Museum
description: Extensive collection of Byzantine-era religious art

name: Hadrian’s Library
description: Roman-era library complex founded by Emperor Hadrian

name: Kerameikos
description: Ancient cemetery and archaeological site

name: National Garden
description: Peaceful public park behind the Greek Parliament

name: Syntagma Square
description: Political and cultural heart of modern Athens

name: Changing of the Guard
description: Ceremony in front of the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier

name: Plaka District
description: Charming historic quarter of winding streets and cafes

name: Monastiraki Flea Market
description: Bustling bazaar of antiques, souvenirs, and street food

name: Ermou Street
description: Pedestrian shopping avenue between Monastiraki and Syntagma

name: Psiri District
description: Trendy area of street art, tavernas, and nightlife

name: Gazi / Technopolis
description: Industrial complex turned cultural/events venue

name: Flisvos Marina & Park
description: Seafront promenade with cafes and yachts

name: Piraeus Harbour
description: Main port linking Athens to the islands

name: Athens Riviera Boat Tour
description: Coastal cruise along the southern coastline

name: Lake Vouliagmeni
description: Thermal spa lake a short drive from the city

name: Cape Sounion Day Trip
description: Sunset visit to the Temple of Poseidon by the sea

name: Marathon Route Tour
description: Visit the start of the original Olympic run

name: Exarchia Street Art Tour
description: Explore murals in Athens’ bohemian quarter

name: Greek Cooking Class
description: Learn to make moussaka, tzatziki, and baklava

name: Athens Wine Tasting
description: Sample Greek wines in a historic cellar

name: Monastiraki Rooftop Bar
description: Acropolis views with cocktails at dusk

name: Acropolis by Night Tour
description: Guided evening ascent under floodlights

name: Athens Ghost Walk
description: Spooky stories in the old city streets

name: Bougatsa Street Stand
description: Local pastry specialty with sweet or savory fillings

name: Greek Coffee Tasting
description: Traditional brewing and reading of grounds

name: Athens Electric Bike Tour
description: Cycle through key neighborhoods with ease

name: Epidaurus & Nafplio Day Trip
description: Visit ancient theater and coastal town

name: Stegnitiki Road Walk
description: Lakeside path around Vouliagmeni Lake
